page.title: 03Farming in St. Ouen(2)
page.content: Some potatoes are hand dug. Those are the potatoes grown in cotils, which is the name for steep sided fields on valley sides and cliff sides. In England this land would probably not be used for arable farming but as Jersey is such a small island farmers have to make good use of all available farm land. After digging, the potatoes are loaded onto a tractor and trailer and are taken to a local packing station, where the potatoes are sorted into mids and wares (mids are the small potatoes and wares are the big ones.) Some of the potatoes are sold locally, the others are shipped to England.
